title: Ticket #4490: Implement CMS's global pool needs
description:
This is an umbrella ticket for tracking CMS's needs for its "global pool" to be ready for 2015.

A short description:

  • This pool is going to be created using glideinWMS out of grid, cloud, and HPC resources.
  • We expect to peak at 200,000 cores in 2015. Typically this doubles every 18 months.
  • Number of queued jobs typically of same the order of the number of running jobs. Peaks up to 400,000 idle jobs.
  • Running approximately 50% for CMS analysis, 50% for Monte Carlo production, except at Tier-1 sites where it will be 5% analysis, 95% Monte Carlo production.
  • We expect a total of 10 schedds - 5 for production, 5 for analysis. The analysis schedds will be running DAGMan tasks while production runs our custom submit software.
  • Expect that jobs will be fairly evenly partitioned across the 10 schedds, so that with 200k jobs running, each schedd will manage ~20k running jobs. However, we'd like 2x headroom, thus we want to target 40k running jobs per schedd. Typical run time for each job is ~8hrs.
  • We will have to abide by various site network policies, meaning:
    • Glideins will run behind firewalls and NATs, necessitating CCB use. We will also want to minimize the number and frequency of TCP connections.
    • We expect at least CERN to provide worker nodes without outbound IPv4 networking.

CmsScaleTestSetup

2014-Sep-17 11:32:48 by tannenba:
Would like to see the requirements specify how many max queued and max running jobs per schedd? Even better - what job throughput rate per schedd? (i.e. "job hertz") ? EDIT After speaking w/ Brian on the phone, I added this information above.
